fields.summary: QA DEMO - Release date displayed off chart
JS error pre 6.0 when escaping a dialog

fields.description:
First off, the new "version" functionality on the Plan board is amazing. It is exactly what we have been hoping for.
I think a good improvement on this would be to color the bubbles according to project similar to the epic bubbles.
fields.summary: As a sprint planner, I would like the version bubbles to be colored according to project.

fields.description:
Upon dragging an issue from one column to another, these two columns are refreshed so that the issue are located on the proper column. 

Certain times, there might be multiple users use the Task Board.  With this scenario:  
# Open two browsers
# Log in to JIRA in both browsers(tested with different users)
# Navigate to Classic Task board
# Configure the task board to have 5 columns (Must add two additional statuses)
# Drag ticket A in the first browser from column one column to another.  Ie nr.3 to nr 5
# Drag ticket B in the second browser from the first column to the second.
# In the second browser, ticket A won't appear on nr.5
fields.summary: Task board does not refreshes every column on issue transitions

fields.description:
Add ability for Sprint maintainer or any other person that makes the change to specify the description of the change.

This way we can be sure that such information is logged and we know the reason for sprint scope changes.
fields.summary: Provide details (comment?) when moving story to/from active sprint

fields.description: Currently, there is no way to export, print the existing "Backlog" of issues in a Scrum Board from within GreenHopper not committed to a sprint.  I would like the ability to export, and/or print the current ranked backlog in GreenHopper for multi-product owner review and ranking reconciliation (more than one product owner means they all can't move backlog items around with cancelling out their own moves part of the time).  I can envision a scenario where a drop down menu appears next to the word backlog, from which a user could select "Export to Excel" (with existing ranking intact), or "Export as a PDF" (with ranking intact), or even possibly "Export as HTML" (once again, with ranking intact).
fields.summary: Ability to Export, Print the Unplanned Backlog in GreenHopper with Ranking Intact

fields.description: Like adding an issue to an epic, we should be able to add an issue to a version from within the planning board.
fields.summary: As a User, I would like to be able to add an issue to a version from the planning board

fields.description: Having dashboard gadgets is awesome, but being able to embed a usable board into a Confluence page would be a great triumph in interoperability.
fields.summary: As a User, I would like to be able to transition issues in the Rapid gadget.

fields.description:
In work mode I had an issue in "in progress". I was unable to move to "done".

After manually resolving the issue it does not show up in the "done" section.

Board: https://jdog.atlassian.net/secure/RapidBoard.jspa?rapidView=273
Issue: https://jdog.atlassian.net/browse/JRADEV-19687
fields.summary: Story could not be moved to Done in work mode on JDOG

fields.description:
The 'Issues in Epic' section only shows up once there is at least one story associated to the epic. 

It would be helpful to have a new option in the 'More Actions' menu to 'Create issue in epic', similar to how 'Create sub-task' works so that the first issue can be added to the epic in Jira. 

We have multiple project managers/projects feeding epics/issues into one team's Agile Board and they primarily manage their issues through their project in Jira. Currently, they create an epic, go the agile board to associate the first issue in epic, then they return to Jira when they have more issues to add to the epic.
fields.summary: As a user who creates epics through jira, I want to add the first issue in epic from the jira issue view, so I do not have to access the Agile board

fields.description:
Customer would like to request for a feature that enable them to add Closed issue from closed sprint to the Epic. Refer below to the actual quote from customer:
{quote}
Our intention is that we want to have complete epic burndown charts (also for the past).
Problem was that epics and epic burndowns were first available since on one of the latest greenhopper releases. So our epic burndown chart is not complete because some issues were not assigned to an epic.

Therefore we need to add closed issues of closed sprints to an epic to have the burndown chart complete.
{quote}

As according to the [documentation|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Adding+an+Issue+to+an+Epic], adding issues to Epic requires the issues at least to be visible on the planning board.

Would like to suggest to enable a field or something similar to bulk edit option to include the filter result into an epic.
fields.summary: Adding Closed Issue from Closed Sprint to Epic

fields.description: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Estimating+an+Issue. See the comment from Markus.  Same problem.  Can't edit estimation on board.  Have to edit issue first which is tedious.  Have two projects, works for one not the other, is not permissions.
fields.summary: Unable to edit estimation on agile board

and https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GADGETS/All+Atlassian+Gadgets)
fields.summary: New Gadget: Sprint Burndown (name = just "Burndown" ?) (NB. Wallboard compatible)

fields.description: In addition to letting Board Administrators configure the fields that can be viewed on the "Issue Detail Views" accessed from an Agile Board, there should be possible to make those fields editable.
fields.summary: Inline-Editable Fields in the Issue Detail View

fields.description: see https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/Sprint+26+-+Design

fields.summary: GH updates ADG changes (pre-JIRA 6.0)

fields.description: It seems that rapid/charts/velocity.json is taking ~10s to load on JAC, can we do anything to optimise this?
fields.summary: Velocity Report takes a long time to load

fields.description:
Like in Classic board.

So you can open only single swim-lane or only Verified items of sprint etc.
fields.summary: Open issues in JIRA issue navigator from New Scrum Board -> Work

fields.description:
When on Planning Board.

So you can quickly view tickets assigned to sprint from JIRA issue navigator and do some sorting etc.
fields.summary: "View in JIRA issue navigator" quick link
"Epic link" on JIRA ticket should be as link to that Epic issue

fields.description: Currently, users with "Edit Issues" permission can add or remove an issue from/to a sprint is not very useable as this permission is granted to most of the user but defining the amount of a sprint should only be done by a few users. So would be more feasible to change this permission to "Schedule Issues" permission as it´s a kind of scheduling or migrate it to an explicit permission
fields.summary: As an admin of the board, I'd like to have users with "Schedule Issues" permission to be able to add or remove an issue from/to a sprint

fields.description: Currently on the rapid board, it could show task owner's avatar, but sometimes users don't want to upload their avatar in JIRA. It would be great for user to know the tasks owner directly by showing the owner's name.
fields.summary: As a GH User, it would be great to show assignee's name in Rapid Board.

fields.description:
The Epic Name custom field appears twice as shown below in the attached screenshot.  Not sure if this will cause an issue.

This seems to coincide with the update to support Epics in Greenhopper.
fields.summary: Epic Name Custom Field appears twice

fields.description:
With the original header in OnDemand (and JIRA in general), you could click the Agile link and it'd take you to the last viewed board. Now when the user clicks on Agile, it shows the drop-down with recently viewed boards.

Something like the previous behaviour would be ideal, where you clicked on Agile and it'd go to the last board, and there was a separate dropdown arrow for additional options.
fields.summary: Clicking "Agile" link in new header should go directly to last visited GreenHopper board, same as old behaviour

fields.description:
COS

The user will go through these steps:
# Click to create a project
# Select Scrum / Kanban
# If GreenHopper is NOT installed, display an installation message tailored to the type of instance (BTF/OD)
# For OnDemand, click a link to go to MAC and get the license
# Once license is purchased, go to welcome page for GH with create project dialog open and scrum/kanban selected 
# If user cancels, return to previous page (can create project dialog be open?)
# Add analytics events for every step as much as possible

This should use the existing API as provided by the Internal Systems team (meaning we need to open a new page with MAC and they'll need to log in).

# Copy to be provided. Note to self: make sure to include a warning that you need to be the account owner to enable it. Also that the trial only works if you haven't installed GH before (otherwise you'll be charged).
Copy: https://extranet.atlassian.com/display/GHDEV/GHS-7876+OD+Create+Project+Sequence


(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: What if MAC is inaccessible?
A: (x) Not Answered - I guess the user will get a 404 when they click the link. 

Q: What if a GH jar is present but not enabled?
A: (x) Not Answered - if GH is not licensed, the message will display.
fields.summary: Enable GH on OD instances from the Create Project dialog

fields.description: As in the attached screenshot, there are at least 2 GreenHopper instances with this field configuration for Epic Status. The error presents as being unable to mark the epic as done.
fields.summary: There are some OD instances with messed up Field Configurations for Epic Status

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-7874].
  {panel}

- For this story, Plan Mode only
- Idea is that we have a draggable left side for when people need more space, similar to other products (e.g. Confluence).
- This drag would be remembered per client (local storage) in terms of percentage of window size
- Consider what happens when DV is dragged too far - do other columns collapse or resize
- Consider whether we do two-line issue representation for backlog column

Testing notes below
fields.summary: ADG GH: Resizable Detail View
ADG GH: update displayed issue key maths e.g. G...-1234

fields.description:
This is broken on JIRA 6.0-SNAPSHOT. Caused by the fact that they have removed the Comment operation from their list of issue operations. We were scanning that list to see if the user had permission to add a comment.

Now we will have to add in this operation ourselves on the server side.

To be fixed on *shipit*.
fields.summary: Add Comment button on Issue Detail View is missing
ADG GH: Manage boards

fields.description: So you can continue on your Greenhopper dashboard.
fields.summary: Open "Bulk Change" submenu item in new browser tab/window
Export "Highlight Burndown Chart Report" to Excel for further processing of sprint events
Allow sorting by Event Type on "Highlight Burndown Chart Report"

fields.description: For example, if "Event type" is "Scope change" make background color red. SO it would be much more easier to find events quickly.
fields.summary: Highlight Burndown Chart Report records with different background colors

fields.description: Is it possible to import old sprints which were based on JIRA project versions?
fields.summary: Import old Classic sprints
Automatically assign issues to the current sprint if issue was set resolved or in-progress
Automatically assign issues to the current sprint if there was time logged for them
Allow to set default Agile Board for all users
Allow ordering by sprint in Jira Search

fields.description: Currently if you enable the Sprint field you are required to input Sprint ID (like 1, 2, 3). Would be better to make this as autocomplete and allow to input sprint name instead.
fields.summary: Choose sprint directly from JIRA

fields.description:
There are columns for Date, Issue, Event Type and so on..

Can we add Summary column?
fields.summary: Allow custom columns to be displayed in Burndown Chart

fields.description: On new Planning Board Backlog. So there is no need to open the ticket in separate page.
fields.summary: Input story points (inline editor)

fields.description:
It's currently possible only to send to "top of sprint", "bottom of sprint" or "remove from sprint".

It's sometimes useful to remove issue from current sprint and move it directly to the next scheduled sprint.
fields.summary: Ability to move issue from started sprint to another sprints or next sprint

fields.description: When we export out stories, we'd like to be able to add a column to the view with the epic name. The closest we can get is the epic link. Ideally, we'd like to request the ability to export out the name (Epic Summary) of the epic associated and the Epic link for a given sprint.
fields.summary: As a PM I would like to have the ability to export stories and their respective epics for a given sprint

fields.description:
We closed an issue and the time for the burn down was not reduced. 

The remaining time was first 3d and after we closed the issue, it is was changed to 0d in the Time Tracking View of the issue. But there was no entry  in the History Log of the issue and the burn down did not reduce.
fields.summary: Closed issue doesn't reduce burndown diagram

fields.description: There is no documentation that describes the use of epics created in multiple projects on one Scrum board.
fields.summary: Documentation on using epics from multiple Projects on one Scrum board

fields.description: Allow user to start a sprint even though the user is not administrator of all projects with issues in the sprint.
fields.summary: Allow user to start a sprint even though the user is not administrator of all projects with issues in the sprint.

fields.description: Allow other uses to change which filter an agile board is based on. Currently it is only possible for the owner of the board to change the filter to include new issues to the backlog
fields.summary: Allow other uses to change which filter an agile board is based on

fields.description:
*Background:*

JIRA show button of 'Agile Boards' when Greenhopper is installed in system. In company's that use JIRA as a tool for customer-developer talk, it's important to control the information that can see customer/client.

I want to request a new feature for JIRA that allow to show or hide the button 'Agile Board' by group of user. The ideal scenario is that customers don't see this button but developers can see.
fields.summary: Hide 'Agile Board' by group of users

fields.description:
Currently the select of 'Stories' at https://<instance>/secure/RapidView.jspa?rapidView=1 will only show the issue key, sub-task count & summary.  Current behaviour example is attached.

The proposed improvement would allow users to configure additional items for display or change the ordering.  For example: 
issue key, summary, sub-task count, assignee and priority
fields.summary: Additional configuration of base swimlane data displayed
Fix up shared contexts
Fix up selected board user hashes to be userKeys
All code that uses IssueDataCollectors needs to be able to handle userKeys

fields.description: The work in progress is on a branch.
fields.summary: Finish the GH provided project templates in JIRA 6

fields.description:
The work for this is on a branch of the JIRA plugin (jira-project-templates-plugin)

(!) Development Notes (!)

Q: For each of the files you are modifying, what dependencies rely on or share the code you're changing?
A: (x) Not Answered

Q: What safeguards exist if the GH install fails or is incomplete?
A: (/) That is handled by UPM, if GH is already installed, the installer shouldn't show because GH is providing it's own project templates

Q: Do we have a dependency on UPM version for this to work? If so, do we have a check in place?
A: (/) Dependency on JIRA 6.0+ and the UPM it uses.

Q: How does licensing work? What if GH is unlicensed? Or if a license cannot be obtained from MAC?
A: (/) If no evaluator license can be obtained, the installer will show an error and GH will be unlicensed.

Q: What if a very old version of GH is already installed on the instance?
A: (x) Not Answered
fields.summary: Integrate GH install via JIRA project template

fields.description:
From customer:

{quote}
h4. Motivation
The Report page of the SPRINT! board shows the tickets added / removed / closed, but unfortunately only the ticket ID.
Unless you know all tickets by heart, you need to click the link to see what the ticket is about.

h4. Request
Show the ticket's title in a tooltip (or directly on the report page).
{quote}

Current burndown chart report in latest Greenhopper only show the issue id in the report. This trouble the customer who need to identify the issue id belongs to and it would be great to add a feature(tooltip) to show issue summary when hover to the issue id.
fields.summary: As an user, I would like to view issue summary in the burndown chart of the report.

fields.description:
Before the GH 6.1 upgrade, we used links for the relations between epics and e.g. stories. These relations could be queried with JIRA or JQL Tricks.

Since GH 6.1 the epics are actually linked using the "Epic Name" custom field and searches like the following are no longer possible:

* Search for all Epics without any story
* Search for all stories related to Epics that are "In Progress"
* Search for all stories that have an Epic a certain team is working on
* ...
fields.summary: Provide JQL functions to query epic relations

fields.description:
Based on the previous 2 documentation changes and the migration of ranking field to Global Rank in Greenhopper after 5.8, the schedule permission is required in order to rank in Greenhopper:
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-4737
* https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-5134


Documentation that require changes:
* https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Scheduling+and+Assigning+Issues+in+GreenHopper+Classic

{quote}
Note:

You will need the 'Edit Issues' and either the 'Schedule Issues' or the 'Resolve Issues' permission (depending on the 'Scheduling Permission' setting in your GreenHopper General Configuration) in order to move issues to a different version on the Planning Board.
{quote}

* User with the Resolve Issue Permission and without Schedule Permission will not allow drag and drop to different version box. This even applies when the Scheduling Permission was unchecked due to Schedule Permission is a need to drag and drop for Global Rank.
fields.summary: Documentation changes on Classic board ranking and scheduling required
Create an automation process to test data.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *JIRA Software Cloud*. Using *JIRA Software Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JSWSERVER-7834].
  {panel}

The column statistics in GreenHopper control chart seems inconsistent when configuring the chart refinement. 

As an example, when selecting 2 columns (To Do, In Progress) in the refinement configuration, the statistic for an issue is displayed as follows:
!scshot1.png! 

But when re-configuring the refinement and exclude the To Do column, the same issue statistics is displayed as follows instead:
!scshot2.png!

Note that the statistics for the In Progress changes after configuring the chart refinement, and it looks like the original value is replaced by the To Do column statistic.
fields.summary: Inconsistent column statistics in GreenHopper Control Chart

fields.description: The quicksearch feature of SCRUM boards turned out to be super useful for our teams (especially when searching for a specific issue). Please make it available for KanBan boards (Work mode of both board types) as well!
fields.summary: Allow quicksearch for KanBan boards (Work mode)

fields.description:
Currently, the scope violations can only be identified by manually browsing through the reports. It would be great if there was a way to search for them. 

In the meantime, it would help if you could explain how the scope violations are marked in the database (for custom reporting).
fields.summary: Allow searching for scope violations

fields.description:
If you switch between different reports, the page remembers the last report (which is good) but on a per report basis (which is bad).

Say you want to look at different reports and switch between the report types, every time it will load a different sprint (the one you looked at last for the particular report).

This is confusing and led to several reporting errors in our company!
fields.summary: Current sprint is not remembered for reports (instead it is being remembered on a per report basis)
ADG GH: New swimlane header stalker
ADG GH: Update banding for newer wider world

fields.description: Having the option to either add/force a comment on the the confirmation page for removing an issue from an active sprint would allow users to input a reason for why that issues was remove.
fields.summary: Comment box when removing issue from active sprint

fields.description:
Currently, via the issue navigator, in case adding the column "Sprint", only the issue in a started Sprint had the value. We should have a way to flag the ticket that assigned in the not started Sprint to get a clear status in the issue navigator output.

This will surely improve the output when exporting the data from the issue navigator.
fields.summary: Having a better way to flag the issue in a not started sprint for Greenhopper

fields.description: We have more than a hundred boards by now and it is really difficult to keep track of them. Grouping them by categories just like you can do with projects in JIRA would be a huge help and drive transparency / usability for our users!
fields.summary: Group rapidboards using categories

fields.description:
The version chart had the wrong end date because of the change to put version into a separate object. Also when this was fixed, it was not properly adding a completion point so lines just ended halfway through where the last issue was added / updated. 

Fixed by looking up the right release date and always adding a completion point.
fields.summary: Version chart has wrong end date

fields.description:
In lots of places we repeatedly look for the same element using $ rather than caching it, and we don't always use the most efficient ways to locate elements - would be good to review and update. 

Suggestion: identify 1 file at a time to update to split this up.
fields.summary: Update JS to use most efficient way of finding elements with $

fields.description:
Repro:
- in an environment where bugs don't have estimates
- create a sprint
- add a story with an estimate to the sprint
- change the story type to bug
- look at the burndown report
- still shows points as part of scope
- look at work mode
- points not included in sprint traffic lights

Should be consistent - points should not be included in burndown
fields.summary: Story Points counted in burndown even after issue type is changed

fields.description: When working on the Work tab, it would be utmost efficient to have a shortcut for "Work Log" window. For now, it's either + sign in the Details panel, or using (.) shortcut and then typing Log work. Anything shorter? "w" would be nice.
fields.summary: Create a keyboard shortcut for the "Work Log" window

fields.description: Would be great to be able to edit the remaining hours within a card (field under a thumbnail) instead of clicking an issue to open the Details panel and adjusting the remaining hours there.
fields.summary: As a user I would like to be able to burn hours by clicking on a card

fields.description:
It would be great if we could add a sprint text field we can use when we create a sprint (or anytime after creation). Ultimately, we need the ability to add these details so we can roll them up into common release notes when looking at multiple sprints in a release.

An example text would be "this sprint, we focused on improving our widget for customers as well as some other user stories related to speeding up site performance".
fields.summary: Add sprint details text field for sprints
Please add story points to Story Subtasks and main taks sumarizing its parts

fields.description: Currently is not possible to delete any transition in GH Simplified workflow. Would be more feasible to delete the transition in the workflow to give the users more ability to control.
fields.summary: As a user, I want to be able to delete the transitions in GH Simplified workflow

fields.description: Users want to produce release notes for a Sprint, like they could do on Classic boards with Versions.
fields.summary: Produce Release Notes for a Sprint

fields.description: When you click on Start Sprint, there are values for the Start and End Date of a Sprint, and it is a period of two weeks. You can change these dates, but since every sprint should have the same duration, it would be useful to be able to set the default duration of a Sprint, so everytime you click on Create Sprint the default duration would be the value you set (one week, three weeks, etc).
fields.summary: Ability to customize the default duration of a Sprint

fields.description: If I create subtasks for a parent task, they should inherit the Epic value of the parent by default.
fields.summary: Created subtasks should inherit epic value of parent
Subtasks cuase horizontal scrolling of details view
Display a invalid drop target icon on the version list when trying to assign story for a different project to a version

fields.description:
{{As a user It would be great if I can have reopen sprint functionality in rapid board}}

There are few times that user is accidentally closed sprint and there is no re-open sprint functionality other than creating a new sprint and re-add issues from the previous sprint into a new sprint.
fields.summary: Ability to reopen a sprint

fields.description: e.g. "Versions Scrum" board in Pete's data set.
fields.summary: Version list on single project board does not respect version sequence

fields.description:
As a Scrum board user I'd like to see the issues in the sprint report even they got assigned to a version which does not fits the board's filter (unreleasedversions()) so I do not see empty sprint reports.

The whole thing happens in the ticket's afterlife, when the sprint is over, but it is regression tested, uploaded to live and finally assigned to an upload fixversion and the fixversion got released. Then it suddenly disappears from the sprint report.

A work subfilter (which is a kickass feature on the kanban board) would do the work.
fields.summary: Work subfilter for scrum boards

fields.description:
As User, I want to be able to manage a Non-Functional Requirements (NFR) in GreenHopper agile board:
* NFRs define a qualities of a product, which is not a behavioral requirements (User Stories)
* One NFR can be referred by several User Stories. It means, that each User Story must conform (or is constrained by) NFR's terms
* One User Story may refer to several NFRs. It means, that this User Story must conform (or is constrained by) all terms of all NFRs
* NFRs must not be in backlog
* (?) NFRs must not have Assignee and Resolution fields. (I'm not sure, maybe some else fields). Instead they must have a validity period of time. This period defines, which Releases or Issues is affected by NFR's terms in some time interval.
* There should be a UI zone on the GreenHopper agile board to manage NFRs. As an example - Epics panel. Something congenial.
* There should be a list of NFRs for each User Story in Issue Detail View on the right side of agile board, well recognizable by a User. It must draw his (her) attention: "There are some requirements beside User Story description".
* There should be an ability in Issue Detail View:
*- To access NFR's details
*- (?) To remove NFR
*- (?) To add new NFR
* There should be an ability to view all User Stories referring to specific NFR

Also, please refer to this support discussion [GHS-7315|https://support.atlassian.com/browse/GHS-7315]
fields.summary: Non-Functional Requirements (Qualities) in GreenHopper

fields.description:
We need to have the Time Spent column into the Sprint report when we have our Story points.

We are using both story points and time tracking, and this would help us compare the time spent vs Story points
fields.summary: Sprint Report Time spent vs Story point

fields.description: We need the ability to add screenshots (same as attach files) while in rapid board to an issue, otherwise you have to leave rapid board and go to Jira and add screenshots there.
fields.summary: Ability to add screenshots (same as attach files) while in rapid board

fields.description:
we noted that, by configuring stories as swimlines, when a high priority story with top rank doesn't have sub-tasks, it's degraded down as "other issues", so the team can't see it at the top of the board to be the first to be started, as occurs on phisical boards.

it's really a unexpected behavior, because the issue ordering on plan and work views turns different, and it's forcing us to create sub-tasks even for very small stories.

it would be great to have an option (a checkbox?) to show stories w/o sub-tasks as swimline, like the others.
fields.summary: Order stories by rank on work view (Stories swimlane mode), even if stories has no sub-tasks

fields.description: Add a checkbox on the dialog and store the settings in the local storage

fields.description:
Using the title in this way is not our standard practise.

Also, trailing full stop is not required when message is one sentence long.
fields.summary: "Warning" in message title is not necessary when dropping issues onto invalid version

fields.description:
Steps:

# Create a multi project board
# Drag one or more issues from the same project over to the versions panel
# Drag the issues over an invalid version, but do not drop them.
# Drag the issues back to the backlog.
# Now select one or more issues from another project.
# Drag these issues over to the Versions Panel.

There are no valid drop targets.
fields.summary: Dragging issues onto versions in a multi project board offers no drop targets

fields.description:
Currently, unless there is a failure in loading the browser, the JS test is always green in IntelliJ - it just writes the failures to the console, so you have to search to see if there were any. 

It would make it much easier if we could just see if it was red.
fields.summary: Should be able to run JS tests locally and see it go red if there are failures
